definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Follows isolde, but not love a field.
sentences.chinese: 不求荡气回肠，只求爱一场。

sentences.english: The writer sings an elegy of concuss the spirit returns to bowel for fool's tragedy destiny.
sentences.chinese: 作者为傻子的悲剧命运唱了一曲荡气回肠的挽歌。

sentences.english: I can still remember the strength hearing that word vibrated through my body.
sentences.chinese: 我仍记得听到这个词的时候荡气回肠的感觉。

sentences.english: To feel complete here and now stirring within me.
sentences.chinese: 来这里完全地感受并在让我荡气回肠。

sentences.english: Sudden feeling their action are very solemn and stirring, has suffices soul-stirringly.
sentences.chinese: 突然感觉自己的举动很悲壮，有够荡气回肠。

sentences.english: These three tragedies constitute a soul-stirring big tragedy together.
sentences.chinese: 这三个悲剧一起构成一个荡气回肠的大悲剧。

sentences.english: Only the ordinary is the most beautiful very touching.
sentences.chinese: 只有平凡才是最美的荡气回肠。

definition: soul-stirring (of drama, poem or artwork)/heart-rending/deeply moving
surging forward with great momentum/unfolding on a magnificent scale
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
lit. blood vessels swell wide (idiom)/fig. one's blood runs quicker/to be excited
